definition: to run fast/to speed/to gallop/to disseminate/to spread
to sweep past/to hurtle past/to swoosh past

sentences.english: He saddled his horse, mounted, and rode away at a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 套上鞍子，跨上马背疾驰而去。

sentences.english: The zebra galloped away from the lion.
sentences.chinese: 斑马疾驰飞奔远离狮子。

sentences.english: The plane span out of the runway.
They went belting along the road.
sentences.chinese: 他们沿着马路疾驰而去。

sentences.english: Lightning streaks across the sky over Vinales Valley, Cuba.
sentences.chinese: 古巴的维纳尔斯谷，闪电在天空中疾驰而过。

sentences.english: After all, who doesn't whizz round blind corners on the wrong side of the road from time to time?
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，谁不会时不时地在盲角疾驰着打个回转弯呢？

sentences.english: The car arrowed toward the airport.
sentences.chinese: 汽车像“箭”般向飞机场疾驰。

sentences.english: Horses small as ants thundering through the grass.
sentences.chinese: 长草中疾驰而过的马匹有如蝼蚁。

sentences.english: When he finds out how the horse he's after is burning the earth, his suspicions grow stronger.
sentences.chinese: 当他发现他跟踪的那匹马正在疾驰时，他更加怀疑了。

sentences.english: He was like a horse in harness running downhill with a heavy load behind him.
sentences.chinese: 他俨像一匹上套的马，载着一车物品向山下疾驰而去。

sentences.english: A car came tearing along the street.
sentences.chinese: 一辆小车沿大街疾驰而来。

sentences.english: Tao stooped to pick, a car race car ran.
sentences.chinese: 道弯下腰去捡，一辆疾驰的车子飞奔而来。

sentences.english: This car came hurtling towards me and I thought my number was up.
sentences.chinese: 那辆车朝我疾驰过来的时候，我想我死定了。

sentences.english: The rider spurred forward to his destination.
sentences.chinese: 骑马者朝目的地疾驰而去。

sentences.english: The speeding car barely missed the pedestrian.
sentences.chinese: 疾驰的汽车差点撞上那个行人。

definition: to whistle past/to hurtle past/to zip by
to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to sweep past/to hurtle past/to swoosh past
to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
